Text: This is the Inner Sphere where men are Men!
And where women are Women!

Option: Small Furry Creature from Alpha Centauri
Text: No. Just… no.
You are but a child, barely out of education (possibly still in it), so don't expect respect unless you earn it. One Life Experience.
You're getting started in life. Probably starting to get into trouble. You have two Life Experiences and one Problem.
Still quite young, life expectancy is 150 years if stress, or violence doesn't kill ya! Three Life Experiences and two Problems!
According to their secret police, this is a fantastic place to live with enlightened and caring leaders. According to their secret police…
A cultured power intent on liberating all their neighbours from all that tedious freedom and prosperity; and then teach them to cosplay as Samurai.
A noble, if over-militarised, state intent on liberating all their neighbours. Mostly by shooting at them with autocannon.
Democratic after a fashion: an alliance of provinces, mostly led by nobles, governed (barely) by the hereditary commander-in-chief.
Power corrupts, and wealth is a form of power. The Lyrans have lots of wealth and lots of corruption. Also lots of big 'Mechs.
A smattering of small states, pirate bands and struggling colonies that cling to the edge of the Inner Sphere. You may choose a specific state.
The centre of political power for your home nation, likely a centre of economic and cultural power as well. It's easy to get a lot of attention, for good or ill.
Extra: When picking a specific ‘Mech, ASF or vehicle, you may take your choice of the 1-5 options for your nation.

Text: Not quite as important as the national capital but likely home to a lot of factional politics - also, it's a natural home for secessionist politicians.
Extra: When picking a specific ‘Mech, ASF or vehicle, you may freely choose the 1 value from any other nationality's sub- table.

Text: On the one hand, likely to have a well-educated population and good infrastructure. But more often than not polluted and controlled by major corporations.
Extra: For one crate that contains weapons, you may double the number of weapons inside.

Text: Your homeworld has changed hands more times than you can keep track. If it's not a full on invasion, someone's likely raiding for portable valuables… like a warehouse full of shinies?
Extra: Pick the nationality you border. If rolling for a specific 'Mech, etc you may roll their sub-table if you want.

Text: You're a long way from anything important. So you're not a target, but... well, good luck getting anywhere. The next jumpship is due in six months, if it arrives.
Extra: You may reroll any duplicate numbers for crates, rerolling new duplicates generated too.

Text: All your homeworld has is location - it's a convenient place for jumpships travelling between a dozen important destinations to cross paths and exchange cargo.
Extra: Add 1d6 to the number of shipping crates you inherit. Roll their contents normally.

Text: You've received some training in repairing and modifying the rare advanced technologies that keep war machines going.
Extra: You may apply a +2 modifier to up to two rolls.

Text: You've attended one of the many institutions that turns out the elite officers that lead the armies of the great states.
Extra: You may apply a +1 modifier to up to two rolls.

Text: You may apply a +3 modifier to up to two rolls.
Extra: You may apply a -1 modifier to up to two rolls.

Text: You're from the 1% of the 1% in terms of background: the titled nobility of your home state. You were raised in luxury few enjoy.
Extra: You may apply a +3 modifier to up to two rolls.

Text: You've entered the underworld, breaking laws and social constraints for reasons that you no doubt believed were justifiable.
Extra: You may apply a -3 modifier to up to two rolls.

Text: Most people don't leave their homeworlds, but you have seen dozens, all very different. Few people are so cosmopolitan.
Extra: You may apply a -2 modifier to up to two rolls.

Text: War is hell and you have seen it. Sometimes you can't not see it. If you weren't a soldier, you were caught in the wrong place and saw things no one ever should.
While the Star League had cures for most types of cancer, this was a long time ago. You're not going to die soon, but you are dying. And right now, there's no known treatment.
K-F jumps affect you more than most people - expect every jump to cause severe nausea and disorientation. Rapidly repeated jumps make this much worse.
You owe someone money that you haven't previously been able to repay. Their calculations suggest that handing over your entire inheritance would cover it.
Your government suspects you of treason. They don't have evidence yet but they are looking and will dig and dig until they find something - anything to justify their suspicions.
You and your spouse are supporting three other people. Two are entirely dependent on you financially and for daily care, one is partially dependent on you.
